ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Empirical Bayes thresholding using the methods developed by I. M. Johnstone and B. W. Silverman. The basic problem is to estimate a mean vector given a vector of observations of the mean vector plus white noise, taking advantage of possible sparsity in the mean vector. Within a Bayesian formulation, the elements of the mean vector are modelled as having, independently, a distribution that is a mixture of an atom of probability at zero and a suitable heavy-tailed distribution. The mixing parameter can be estimated by a marginal maximum likelihood approach. This leads to an adaptive thresholding approach on the original data. Extensions of the basic method, in particular to wavelet thresholding, are also implemented within the package.

Empirical Bayes thresholding using the methods developed by I. M. Johnstone and B. W. Silverman. The basic problem is to estimate a mean vector given a vector of observations of the mean vector plus white noise, taking advantage of possible sparsity in the mean vector. Within a Bayesian formulation, the elements of the mean vector are modelled as having, independently, a distribution that is a mixture of an atom of probability at zero and a suitable heavy-tailed distribution. The mixing parameter can be estimated by a marginal maximum likelihood approach. This leads to an adaptive thresholding approach on the original data. Extensions of the basic method, in particular to wavelet thresholding, are also implemented within the package.

name: r-ebayesthresh
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.4-12' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ebayesthresh
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: EbayesThresh_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/EbayesThresh_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/EbayesThresh/EbayesThresh_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 28850348aa0752a75e0c8f1ae20ef7e352a6493abe8b6a6c40ac09f5476b421d

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 1007
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-wavethresh
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-wavethresh

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('EbayesThresh')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('EbayesThresh')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/stephenslab/EbayesThresh
  license: GPL (>= 2)
  summary: Empirical Bayes thresholding using the methods developed by I. M. Johnstone and B.
    W. Silverman. The basic problem is to estimate a mean vector given a vector of observations
    of the mean vector plus white noise, taking advantage of possible sparsity in the
    mean vector. Within a Bayesian formulation, the elements of the mean vector are
    modelled as having, independently, a distribution that is a mixture of an atom of
    probability at zero and a suitable heavy-tailed distribution. The mixing parameter
    can be estimated by a marginal maximum likelihood approach. This leads to an adaptive
    thresholding approach on the original data. Extensions of the basic method, in particular
    to wavelet thresholding, are also implemented within the package.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
